definition: Scientists who study the relationships between organisms and their environments.
The distance between nests within a colony or among different colonies.
A type of bee known for not having the ability to sting, distinct from more common stinging varieties.
Groups of the same species that compete against each other for resources such as nesting sites.
The act of searching for food in the environment.
Areas where resources, like flowers, are concentrated and plentiful.
The spatial arrangement of animal colonies within an area.
An arrangement where objects or points are grouped together, forming clusters.
Chemical substances produced and released into the environment by an animal, affecting the behavior or physiology of others of its species.
To increase in intensity or magnitude, used here to describe fights that grow more intense over time.
Extended conflicts that last a significant amount of time.
Actions or behaviors that are formalized and follow a set pattern or convention, often with symbolic meaning.
Death within a population; in this case, bees dying as a result of fights.
